results.title: Working and playing to health
results.brief_description: Shows the programs of recreational, occupational and industrial therapy for the patients of a mental hospital. Explains why and how these techniques are used to bring patients back to health.

results.title: Work study case histories. No. 1
results.brief_description: An analysis of press cropping of mild steel bars is designed to help work study lecturers; each operation requiring special work skills and techniques. The first part is a complete record of the original method filmed as it would be see by a work study engineer. The film would then be stopped for students to carry out their studies before seeing the improved methods actually installed by the firms.

results.title: [Wool Fashion Awards, 1965 and 1966]
results.brief_description: Models show a variety of garments which won the Fashion Awards for 1966. Knitted jumpers, suits, skirts, and day and evening dresses, ensembles and coats. Photographed at Eltham using Montsalvat as a background.

results.title: Wool Fashion Awards of 1960
results.brief_description: Every year, a fashion contest to promote wool as a fabric is held by the Australian Wool Bureau. In 1960, Melbourne compered the awards and this film shows many of the winning entries in the fifty-five sections. Those modelled include suits, coats, dresses, knitwear and slacks. The supreme award for 1960 is the climax of the parade of gold medal winners, held at the end of four days judging.

results.title: The Woodwind choir
results.brief_description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. Compositions by Brahms, Mendelssohn, Rossini, von Weber, Beethoven, and Schumann are used to demonstrate the function of woodwind instruments in full orchestral setting.
results.description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. results.title: Wood joints
results.creator_credit: Joe Jayward, James McCormick and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Precise camerawork shows clearly how the end butt joint is made, how to make a rabbet joint, how a dado joint is formed, and the difference between the dado joint and the groove joint. Also demonstrates the technique of using dowels to add strength to a joint and how to make a lap joint.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe Jayward, James McCormick and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.description: Precise camerawork shows clearly how the end butt joint is made, how to make a rabbet joint, how a dado joint is formed, and the difference between the dado joint and the groove joint. Also demonstrates the technique of using dowels to add strength to a joint and how to make a lap joint.

results.title: Wonder birds of Australia
results.creator_credit: Harold J. Pollock and Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Studies the unique characteristics of Australian birds including distinctive bird calls, flight sequences and the variety of parrots and honeyeaters. Illustrates the unique behaviour of the cassowary, bower bird, mallee fowl, scrub turkey and the lyrebird. Narrated by John Dease.

results.title: The Women's Royal Australian Army Corps
results.creator_credit: Central Video Film Service Australian Army Public Relations
results.brief_description: The life and work of servicewomen in the WRAAC shows them as signal and survey corps personnel, as drivers, storeswomen and caterers, and in a variety of office jobs. Many courses are available through which they may become officers. The type of accommodation provided and after-hours recreations available.
